name: The New Yorker Hotel

reviews.text: I brought a group of high school students (64) to NY for a journalism convention at Columbia University. I've done this three times and stayed at a different hotel each time. This is the first time that I've found a place we will definitely rebooking for our next visit.
reviews.title: Comfortable and convenient

reviews.text: Upon arrival, our keys (for 20 rooms) were ready and we had no problems checking in. The hotel is located right around the corner from Penn station and about a block away from the red lines.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The in-hotel diner was great -- good food and reasonably priced for New York. The rooms were generally spacious, though there was quite a difference in size, with one group even getting a room that had two bathrooms. The only issue was that the water temperature in the shower was inconsistent, but that's pretty minor.
reviews.title: very happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we had a great experience and will we back in two years.
reviews.title: Great location for a fantastic city break

reviews.text: I just recently returned from my trip to NYC and stayed at The New Yorker. We had a fantastic stay at this hotel and would definitely return! The room was clean and the bathroom was impeccably clean as well. The location is perfect for theatre goers. No taxis to worry about as it is walking distance to Broadway and Time Square. My teenager particularly enjoyed the convenience of the Tick Tock Diner especially after a show. The diner is attached to the hotel. Good food and very reasonable. We stayed on the 26th floor so we didn't hear any of the traffic. The concierge was friendly and helpful and the staff went out of their way to make our stay memorable.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.text: We stayed here early April 2013. The hotel is located in what I would consider a perfect tourist location. The Empire state is literally down the road in eyes view from the building. Our room was on the 34th floor with a great view of the Hudson river. The room was not huge but prefect for what we needed. We came to see the city not enjoy a luxury room. The room was cleaned and made up everyday to a high standard. The bathroom was clean and the shower and bath worked fine. Staff were helpful and are happy to sort out airport transfers whatever the time of day. All in all a prefect City Explorer hotel. I would definitely return
reviews.title: Perfect City location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband recently took me to New York to celebrate my 60th birthday, and the New Yorker was a great choice of hotel. The iconic art deco lobby was so impressive, and the staff were so helpful I knew we were in for a treat. Our room wasn't very big, but had everything we needed and the bed was big and comfortable. We walked MILES in New York so we needed our comfortable bed! The art deco theme was replicated in our room and on the landing by the lifts, in the lights and mirrors. We ate a couple of times in the Tick Tock Diner which has been reviewed by others, and that also was really good. Reasonably priced good food in a very 1950s setting. Although you could breakfast more cheaply at a local deli we enjoyed our pastry, fruit salad and coffee bought in the hotel lobby and eaten there - just people watching. The Tick Tock Diner is open 24 hours a day, and needless to say they do a mean breakfast also. The Concierge service was a great help sorting out ferry tickets, and all kinds of other tickets or queries to do with restaurants or transport. We found all the staff very friendly and approachable. The location of this hotel was ideal - about half-way between uptown and downtown and as we wanted to see both we were perfectly positioned. If we went back to New York we would definitely book to stay here again. I think the 3* rating is on the mean side.
reviews.title: Great friendly service in iconic hotel

reviews.text: A very good stay with great value for New York City. Art Deco feel throughout the hotel and incredibly close to the Penn Train station. Angel at the front desk could not have been more helpful and got the stay off to a great start.
reviews.title: Good value, strong service and conveinant location

reviews.text: I stayed at the The New Yorker Hotel for 3 nights last week. The rooms are average size for New York, meaning they are small. They are very clean and the room I was in had a lot of light. The room did not have a coffee maker in the room which was a challenge for me since I don't go out in public without a cup. I learned that you can ask for one though. The bathroom did not have a lot of surface area for my stuff but the shower had really good pressure and a large tub. The continental breakfast was average. I would woudl recommend this hotel because it's is a good value in an excellent location. I did not use the fitness center because the hotel is a few blocks from the Hudson which has a great path for running.
reviews.title: Clean and Decent Place to Stay

reviews.text: We stayed in Rm 3201. It was an average sized room with west views towards the Hudson River.
reviews.title: Nice, Clean Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Clean, great service and staff, nice location, we got a great price on this hotel. Lobby was nice. Flat screen TV, nice views, bathroom shower and fixtures worked just fine. Comfortable, firm bed.
reviews.title: Great location, tiny rooms!

reviews.text: Cons: Very small bathroom, old decor, needs updating.
reviews.title: Perfect location ! Ideal base !

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel even with the cons mentioned.
reviews.title: Baked alive

reviews.text: Stayed at this hotel for four nights and from check-in to departure everythng was great. The staff could not be more helpful if they tried. We also were given an upgraded room with a view across the Hudson on the 33rd floor. The room was very clean and was kept clean by the good housekeeping throughout our stay. Had really comfy beds!! The security at the hotel was impressive, there was always someone checking that you were actually staying at the hotel before you could use the lifts to your room, which we found very reassuring being two women on our own. All in all great hotel in central location, right near Empire State Bldg, and if I go back I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice, clean, central hotel and very helpful, friendly staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would definately stay at the New Yorker hotel again. The location is perfect.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: We flew into Newark international and got the NJ Transit train ($15 each) from the airport to Penn Station, Manhattan. The hotel is literally one block away which made getting from the train with our luggage easy. The New Yorker is also 5 minutes away from the Empire State Building and 2 minutes away from Madison Square Garden (its above Penn Station).
reviews.title: Very pleasant hotel experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel itself was very good. We weren't expecting anything special but the rooms were of a good size and the staff were friendly. You can leave your luggage in reception on your last day for just 1 dollar per bag (if you have a late flight).
reviews.title: The Place to Stay on a Budget

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You'll probably spend most of your time out exploring New York City anyway!
reviews.title: It's okay ish

reviews.text: We're not usually a budget travellers, but booked one night at this hotel because of an arrival in NYC one day earlier than planned. We had to wait one night untill we continued to our destination.
reviews.title: Did not sleep for a second.

reviews.text: The hotel had notified before booking that there were some contruction going on and that's fair and decent. It was noticable in the lobby that they were redecorating. By the time this review is written the renovation may be finished. Anyway this didn't bother us too much for the one night we were staying.
reviews.title: Exceeded Our Expectations!!!

reviews.text: We arrived quite late in the evening and upon check-in we were upgraded to a suite on the 42nd floor. At first glance the suite looked very nice. The bathroom were nice and clean. The room seemed to be of the newly renovated ones. We are very grateful for the very nice and complimentary upgrade from the hotel.
reviews.title: GREAT STAY
Very good choice
reviews.text: The suite included a living room, a small kitchen area and a bedroom (with bathroom of course). Flat screen TVs in both rooms. Nice bathroom. Clean. The only thing was that the living room seemed a bit overstuffed as the furnitures required a lot of space. I think maybe some lighter furnitures would have made the room a bit more spacious.

However there were some issues with this suite. First of all it was cold outside, but the room was still very warm. Being on the 42nd floor you could only open the window a few inches and had to use the aircondition. For the night this proved to be a problem.
reviews.title: Great location, helpful staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The New Yorker is one of those iconic old school New York buildings that stares back at you from a million calendars and postcards - and the lobby doesn't disappoint, packed with Art Deco features.
reviews.title: Budget accommodation that's perfectly serviceable

reviews.text: The rooms are a bit cramped, but the location is what brings you here - right in the middle of the madness. We were advised to ask for a room "higher up" as these should be bigger and more recently renovated - not sure if this is true, because everything looked a bit "tired", though it was all clean and perfectly serviceable.
reviews.title: Iconic NYC hotel in a very central location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Visit the Tick Tock Diner that's on site, if only to watch the organised chaos that is breakfast! How they make sense of it, I really can't fathom!
reviews.title: Nice hotel in a good location

reviews.text: This is not a hotel for lounging in for hours at a time - but that's not why you go there! Dump your bags and get out into the thick of the action, at a price that's more than reasonable. Staff were virtually invisible, but that's not a bad thing when you're just "in and out" to shops, restaurants, theatres etc etc.
reviews.title: excellent hotel - well worth it!!

reviews.text: One of NYC's iconic hotels from the 1930's, the New Yorker is quite charming. The huge lobby still retains many of the features that made this such a famous hotel when it opened in 1929.
reviews.title: Premium hotel in excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is busy and the staff was kind, but we could not shower there. The water trickled out of the shower head so we were reduced to sponge bathing. We were not happy and will not return.
reviews.title: Horrible Shower

reviews.text: On a positive note, the restaurants attached were pretty good and the hotel location is very convenient to Penn station and Port Authority bus terminal.
reviews.title: Business Trip to NYC

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very busy lobby full of tourists. Plan on checking out extra early if you want to leave bags and go out for the day, the line is very long.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel! Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a disappointment. Were there to celebrate a special occasion. Hard to get ready for a fine dining experience without a proper shower.
reviews.title: Few days stay in the New Yorker

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stay if you need to be near Penn station. Otherwise STAY AWAY!!
reviews.title: Magic Hotel
Fantastic location - don't expect a big room though!
reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights on our first trip to NYC. The hotel is massive (as is everything else in the city!) although the rooms are just about big enough to hold a double bed, writing desk, chest of drawers and little else.

reviews.title: It was a great location, great service, staff friendly and genuine
reviews.text: The room was tidy and the bed comfortable, which is all you need when in New York. There is a diner connected to the hotel, and coffee/croissants available to buy in the lobby every morning.

reviews.title: great location
reviews.text: The staff were very helpful and informative, although there is a small charge to hold your luggage once you've checked out.

reviews.title: Best value for location I've found.
reviews.text: Times Square is a few blocks walk, as is 5th Avenue and Broadway. The subway which runs by the hotel takes you to many areas of the city, or to a connection to other lines.

reviews.title: Excellent location, lovely hotel
reviews.text: This was the cheapest 3* hotel by far, and would definitely stay again

reviews.title: if you get a good deal, definately worth the stay
reviews.text: First of all, my expectations of new york were not not great, as im from London I pressumed that New york would just simply be be a bigger version...how wrong I was. Getting to the hotel from JFK wasnt too bad. We paid $24 for a return by coach and the jouney took approximately 45 mins. Booking in was a peice of cake, 15 mins max, and whilst waiting we had a chance to admire the lobby area which was suprisingly impressive for a 3* hotel. The room was quite small, but New York is definately not the sort of place where you spend your holiday in a hotel room! Just a two minute walk from Time square, the hotel is perfectly positioned, and will allow you to explore that part of New york well without venturing too far from the hotel. Clean, freindly staff and comfortable beds...well worth the stay. I will be writting a seperate review for New York for anyone whos interested, and will be uploading our holiday pics-have a great time!

reviews.title: Great hotel in a superb location for the leisure traveller
reviews.text: First time to stay at this hotel but on next visit to New York The New Yorker will be my first choice. I lover the "older style" decor giving the place a grandeur look from the past. The room were clean, bedding changed frequently ....yes maybe the room was smaller than most hotels but I only want it to sleep in so as long as the bed is comfortable and its got an en suite there is no more I want. The bed was absolutely huge could have slept 4 with ease.

reviews.title: Good value art deco experience
reviews.text: The staff were so polite and efficient. I went accross road to get us a couple of Starbucks coffees and getting out of the lift on the 32nd floor I dropped one spilling it everywhere. A member of staff appeared from nowhere, assuring me there was no problem and he would attend to it right away...within 3 or 4 mins it was all cleared up

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel with excellent view
reviews.text: Superb view from 32nd floor bedroom window looking down at the Manhatten skyline and Staue of Liberty....cant recomend this hotel highly enough

reviews.title: Recommended hotel
reviews.text: I had real trouble finding a central manhattan hotel at under $250 a night. When I found the New Yorker through my airline I thought it sounded too good to be true. But it wasn't. The New Yorker is a lovely art deco hotel in a very central location. Two blocks to Macys, a short walk to Times Sqaure and all the theatres, also across the road from Madison Sqaure Gardens.

I couldn't believe the size of my room and the bathroom for a NYC hotel. There were much larger than what I expected. The free Wi-Fi is limited to something like 500 kbps, but it worked for me (a higher bandwidth connection is available for a fee). Room was clean and had a HUGE closet. Even though the hotel was recently updated, the hallways did look a bit worn. Still, for a comparable hotel in NYC, it was a good value.
reviews.title: Huge Rooms for NYC

reviews.text: I stayed in many hotels in NYC, and New Yorker is simply disappointing. Huge chaotic hotel with several groups staying in. Location is good, the rooms are better sized than some more modern hotels, cannot say any other positive things about New Yorker. Everything is so uninspired and dated, design is absent, service is not good at all. I got the reservation through Hotwire, but even with fairly good rate is not a great value. There is only one hotel in NYC I truly enjoyed: Fashion 26, but if you prefer something more traditional, even Roosevelt is better than New Yorker.
reviews.title: Mediocre at best

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All of the staff I dealt with were professional and courteous. Waited a few minutes at check in because the room had been cleaned, but not yet inspected, and they wanted to make sure it was checked over before giving me the key - impressive. Small, but comfortable room, larger than the typical Manhattan shoebox. Very clean. (Clearly passed that inspection!) Minimal hall noise. Comfortable bed. Pleasantly surprised by the *amazing* fitness center and consistent security key checks at elevators. Far from luxurious (except for that fitness center!), but nice for the price. Would definitely book again.
reviews.title: Nice for the Price - Would stay again

reviews.text: Stayed in the New Yorker for our first ever visit to NYC this month. The particular creature on reception does nothing for first impressions of the hotel or the city. Arrived to find an incorrect room allocation so when we went back to the desk we met the rudest and most anti-customer service person ever, literally a walking attitude problem who informed us that it was our problem and what did we expect her to do about it! She went to the extent of slapping out booking form at us on the desk and at one point lead us to believe that we'd have to find other accomodation...even though we had pre-paid via a travel agent.
reviews.title: New Yorker Hotel- mostly good, beware the attitude problem receptionist

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In all fairness to the rest of the staff and the hotel, we could only fault this person. Everyone else we dealt with was great especially the staff of tick tock diner. Security is excellent. The twin room we had was fine, clean (great accomodation staff), beds very comfortable. The only criticism of the room is the bathroom which has no fan making it a steamroom after 2 minutes in the shower. Location is great, very central.
reviews.title: New Yorker hotel good base for a holiday

reviews.text: We had a great time at the New Yorker, We were lucky to get a room at the 38th floor with a terrace (a great thank you to Kelvin Diaz who made it possible) allowing us to enjoy a great view. The breakfast option at the sky lounge was really nice, we had a terrific view of the skyline every morning.
reviews.title: Great stay at the New Yorker Hotel

reviews.text: The New Yorker Hotel is probably the best located hotel in Manhattan.
reviews.title: New York then and now

reviews.text: The Hotel is styled in the Retro 20s / 30s style. You expect Glenn Miller or Tommy Dorsey to be wafting sounds across the vast lobby. The Concierge, Bell Hops, Desk clerks and Information team rush to help and assist. Immediately you're feeling welcome and know that you're in the hands of courteous professionals.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel

reviews.text: All of the fantastic vibrant city is within easy reach from the 8th Avenue location. Times Square and Broadway are a few blocks to the North. Macy's, Madison Square Gardens and the Empire State Building are a couple of blocks to the East. The Javit Conference centre is to the West and The Financial District, Chelsea, SoHo, NoHo and the Villages are due south. The internal lobby is a sight to behold and you can easily drift back in time and picture President JFK walking through the Door or Joe Di Magio popping in to rest up in his room. Muhammad Ali and Nikolas Tesla are among some of the famous former occupants. The room views are breathtaking. Either the Hudson River or the most famous skyline in the world. The Diner on the ground floor "The Tick Tock Diner" is without doubt one of the best family diners in the whole of New York. The service is wonderful but you also get the delightful New York sass thrown in also.
reviews.title: Very good, very interesting plaque
Outstanding customer service
reviews.text: The Hotel offers a Limo pick service to and from the Airports (JFK, Newark and La Guardia all catered for). Pennsylvania Station is directly opposite the Hotel giving full rail access to all of New York. a few blocks North is New York Port Authority Bus Terminus again placing all of New York at your fingertips. Directly outside the Hotel you will find the Tourist bus operators selling passes for the open top tour buses, which allow you too hop on and off as long as your ticket is valid. Taxis are available right at the door, if one isn't available the concierge will hail one. The surrounding area buzzes with atmosphere of the real and authentic New York. Don't bother booking anywhere else. This is the place to stay.
I arrived at this hotel late at night driving a rental car. Parking was extremely expensive—so unless you want to pay $30+ a night for parking do not come with a car.
reviews.title: Good New York City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But the staff were very friendly and the room was small (like many NYC hotel rooms) but well appointed. Unfortunately the air conditioning in my room did not work but they fixed it and then when I complained they immediately changed me to a different room. The business center is not fantastic but is usable. The location of amazing and the price is reasonable.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed with The New Yorker for 5 nights late June. We requested a quiet room away from the lifts and got exactly what we asked for with views of the Hudson River. Our room was whisper quiet and when I asked for a Coffee machine, it was promptly sent up without question. Concierge always appeared in high demand, so we tended to ask the information/transport desk staff when needing directions etc.
reviews.title: Great location
Great location - Small rooms
reviews.text: Yes there were a lot of homeless people/beggars on all the streets of Manhatten, and having Penn Station subway just out the door, meant there were quite a few just outside the front of the hotel. With views of the Empire State Building and the mass of humanity, depending which direction your room was facing, if you want to be in the centre of the action, you could not ask for a better location. However, Manhatten seems to work like a well oiled machine considering the hoards of people on the sidewalk at any time of the night or day, so it pays to wear excellent walking shoes and watch where you are walking at all times (so you dont slip on the sidewalk cracks/potholes). We found the chinese laundry down a side alley at rear of hotel a real find for doing your washing from wo to go for $6. Tick Toc Diner was great the second visit, however on our first visit on a Sunday morning, it was clearly packed to the rafters and the serving staff were run off their feet. It took several requests for that second cup of tea. Would I stay @ The New Yorker again, most definitely if I were younger and wanting to see all the sights - as its location is faultless. However, I would want a bar fridge or some form of refrigeration so I could at least drink my coffee/tea with real milk in my room. BTW, try walking from the hotel to 125th street (Apollo Theatre) through Central park. Yes it may take you 4 hours dawdling, but its worth the experience to get a real feel of how people tick on a Sunday.

Stayed 9 nights at this hotel. Whilst our room was a bit on the small side it was clean and comfortable and in my opinion fit for purpose. The staff, with a few exceptions, were extremely courteous and helpful and nothing was too much trouble
reviews.title: RACIST! Terrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My family and I stayed at this hotel for seven nights in November '09. The location of the hotel is very good, opposite Penn Station, just down from The Empire State Building and right next to Madison Square Garden, we had no problems finding our way around and getting to all the sites/locations that we wanted to see. Check in was quick and easy, we had to extend our stay as our flights had been changed and therefore had two bookings for the hotel, we requested when we checked in to stay in the same room for the second half of the booking which was granted with no problems. Our room was clean and of a reasonable size, others have said that the rooms were small but we found them plenty big enough for us, my only gripe would be that me and my husband had to share a double bed and we usually have a king, so it was a bit of a squeeze, but my husband seemed to have no problems with this judging from the snoring! The bathroom was fine and the shower was a good size. Maid service was also fine. Security were efficient, we had opened our room door and then left it on the latch while we went back into the room to get something, after about five minutes security had come to the door to see why it had been left open. We ate at the TickTock diner everyday for breakfast which is located in the hotel and can be accessed via the lobby, this was for convenience more then anything the food was edible but have had better at Ihop. Overall I would defiantly recommend this hotel for a stay in New York City.
reviews.title: Enjoyable stay

reviews.text: I just got back from this hotel.. And I have to admit that it was best stays ever. I had some issues at the beginning. I hate to used credit cards and I called the hotel the day before to ask if I needed one. I was told no so I didn't even bother to reload my prepaid one. When I got to the hotel they told me I had to have one... They were nice enough to hold my stuff while I ran around looking for a green dot location. We found out there was one eight blocks down, went down there and they were sold out. The only place in the city that sold them and they were out. Thankfully the staff at the New Yorker was amazing and helped us get a room. Because of everything that happened they even upgraded us to a better room. The room was amazing. It was the perfect location. Right across from Madison Square Garden (we came in for a wrestling show from PA). I can't tell you how greatful I was to the staff. It was everything I could have ever asked for (for the first time staying overnight in NYC) and so much more. The New Yorker is amazing and I am so thankful that I got to stay there.
reviews.title: New Yorker.. Thank you for making NYC so great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at The New Yorker from the 9th June to the 14th June. Our first impressions of the actual hotel were amazing but after facing the miserable cretin on the desk, our thoughts were turned upside down. He was apparently the Night Manager. We had just arrived off a flight from Los Angeles so we were absolutey shattered. When we approached the desk, he DEMANDED a credit card and immediatley tried to take money off of it. He didnt explain to us what he was doing. When he couldnt get $270 off it, he DEMANDED another one. When we questioned what he was doing, he replied "incidentals, incase YOU smoke in the room". When we replied that we dont smoke, he basically said he didnt care and he wanted the money.
reviews.title: What can i say?...........

reviews.text: We told him we didnt have that much on the card, then he THREW the card back at us and said "Im not checking you in then!" Eventually we had to give him $300 cash. When he recieved it, he was like a kid in a sweet shop. He was so happy! Prat. The hotel was also told that it was my partners 30th birthday but we were on the 25th floor with a view of other peoples rooms and the room was quite 'compact'.
reviews.title: It's okay.

reviews.text: All in all, it was a really nice hotel within a good area, easy access to the Subway. But some of the staff need training. Obviously, the higher your floor, the quieter it is. Also you are only a 10-15min walk from Times Square!!
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well situated to explore the city. The hotel was to a good standard, rooms were of a smallish size but well equipped, very comfy bed, tv, safe in the room, iron and hair drier. This hotel is ideal for people who spend most of their time sight seeing. Check in was efficient, staff were courteous and the room was cleaned each day to a good standard.
reviews.title: The New Yorker Hotel....... 2013. Couple from England.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great value for money and we would use it again next time we visit New York.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel

reviews.text: As we were first timers to New York, getting a decent hotel was important, but nothing prepared me for the fantastic New Yorker Hotel. From entering the grand foyer we were met at the desk by Mohammed who was the friendliest, nicest and most helpful person you could wish to meet. He was the first point of contact at this hotel and what an impression he made, from meeting him and then the rest of the staff, they couldn't do enough for us.
reviews.title: everything was great! Location and everything is in walking...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were great, make sure you ask for a room with a view right enough. They were clean, tidy and everything worked perfectly. The room service was excellent and the daily room cleaning was great.
reviews.title: What a pleasant stay

reviews.text: The location of this hotel was perfect for sight seeing, especially as you are beside Maddison Square Garden, Penn Station and just a few blocks from Times Square. There were subway stations very close but most places were walkable anyway.
reviews.title: My vacation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For a first time visitor to New York, the location of this hotel is excellent - bang in the middle of the city, close to Macys, Empire State, Madison Square Garden and if you love walking, equi distant from Central Park or down to the Financial District. It is really touristy though and exceptionally busy.
reviews.title: Functional hotel in a good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only criticism of the location would be that we love nice bars and restaurants and the choice around the hotel was all diners and Irish pubs. It was a $15 cab ride down into Greenwich Village/Soho (where there are loads of nice places to eat and drink) and would probably stay in these areas if we visited again.
reviews.title: Would definitly stay there again!!
New Yorker
reviews.text: The staff were really helpful, especially the concierge who were happy to get us jazz club reservations, theatre tickets etc...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had paid for an upgraded room and the man on reception said he had upgraded us again to an even bigger room - well if this was a double upgrade, I would hate to see the size of a standard room as our room was really small with barely enough space for the double bed and TV. We had read previous reviews and had expected the rooms to be small (which is why we paid for an upgrade) but do be prepared for very small rooms.
reviews.title: Friendly in great location

reviews.text: In summary this is a really good hotel just to dump your stuff and get out into the city, do not expect luxury or the 'personal touch', the lobby is busier than Leeds station at rush hour but as a base to see the main sites, it does the job very well.
reviews.title: great location, helpful staff, clean and safe

reviews.text: Great location to experience New York. The room was clean and had 2 bathrooms which really comes in handy when traveling with women. The bathrooms were small but not tiny, I didn't feel cramped but i wasn't expecting a bathroom suite. I just needed a place to handle business and keep it moving. The attached diner was alright for diner food. Chef Yu's right down the street was defintely a better treat. I really don't have any complaints about our stay.
reviews.title: Clean - Convenient - Cozy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Check in: confronted with a clerk who clearly could not care less, got to our room- a SINGLE. For 2 people with a weeks reservation! And we paid PREMIUM prices. Nope, went back down to the desk, stated our case, the first clerk told us this was the room grade for 1-800-hotels.com guests. Fortunately, Mohammed was able to find us a slightly larger room, and KEPT apologizing about the lack of view! I just was happy to be able to get to the bathroom without tripping over my spouse. So, room amenities were fine. The problem came in the bar. When we asked for a rocks glass & a wine glass for the room, we were told that the bar was separate from the hotel, and could not accomadate us. So why could I charge my bar tab to my room? Just don't LIE to your customers in hope of one more round. Believe me, we found a place that sold glasses so we could have a quiet drink in our room! And we spent plenty in that bar anyway, so why unsult us of by being greedy?
reviews.title: Ok, but disappointing for a seasoned traveler.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have to complain about one blond bartender on our Friday night who was so rude as to be deservedly fired. She was so busy chatting up some lawyer type that she got completely snooty when an Irish patron asked her to repour his beer with a proper head; and an Englishman who rightly complained when she poured him bourbon instead of the Scotch he requested. I don't need attitude from a server; it's why they are there!
reviews.title: Brilliant Hotel - great location!

reviews.text: The hotel is lovely!
reviews.title: Great location, decent rooms but looking rather tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room is comfortable and clean, bathroom is small (but you don't spend your vacation in there anyways!).
reviews.title: Good value

description: The New Yorker Hotel is one of the most popular hotels in New York City. Come revel in the newly re-imagined grandeur of our historic hotel. Our newly renovated and upgraded guest rooms and suites deliver contemporary comforts that leave nothing to be desired for today’s business travelers.
